CatDescriptText: Mrs. M.L. Ellis, homemaker, 7153 Lemington Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The people and Congress are responsible. The people put Representatives and Senators into Congress to do what is right.  If they don't do what they think is right to bring about just laws, the people should remove them, that is, relieve them of their money making jobs."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. M.L. Ellis wearing sleeveless floral dress and sunglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
